coarsermi

Class UnifiedClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • coarsermi.UnifiedClient

  • public final class UnifiedClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Class whose static memebers unify the use of more client object peers. This class contributes to the ObjectPeer objects transparency, allowing the developer to deal with rmeote objects stubs only. Moreover it exports a method to get the backing object peers. All the created object peers uses the same instance of ObjectRegistry, allowing a server to access objects published on the client for other servers.
    Author:
    Salvatore Giampa'

    • Method Detail

      • getRegistry

        public static ObjectRegistry getRegistry()

      • getStub

        public static <T> T getStub(java.lang.String address,
                            int port,
                            java.lang.String objectId,
                            java.lang.Class<T> stubInterface)
                     throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                            java.io.IOException
        Gets the stub for the specified object identifier on the specified host respect to the given interface. Similar to the ObjectPeer.getStub(String, Class) method, but creates a new ObjectPeer if necessary to communicate with the specified host.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the stub object
        Parameters:
        address - the host address
        port - the host port
        objectId - the remote object identifier
        stubInterface - the stub's interface
        Returns:
        the stub object
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host address cannot be resolved
        java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur

      • getObjectPeer

        public static ObjectPeer getObjectPeer(java.lang.String address,
                                       int port)
                                throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                       java.io.IOException
        Gets the ObjectPeer object for the specified host. If it has not been created, creates it.
        Parameters:
        address - the host address
        port - the host port
        Returns:
        the object peer related to the specified host
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host address cannot be resolved
        java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur
